message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a method for generating video-realistic animations of real humans using a neural network. This involves tracking the 3D motion of the person in the video using a template model and subsequently generating a synthetically rendered version of the video. The paper also evaluates the method for the reenactment of another person that is tracked to obtain the motion data. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR). The paper also involves multimedia (cs.MM) and machine learning (cs.LG) techniques, which are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses a conditional generative adversarial network (GAN) for image synthesis, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
